description: Conversion of a single family dwellinghouse into three self-contained residential units (3 x 2bed flats); and single storey rear/side extension
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | 	The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s)13/633/03 REV received on 10/10/2013 unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surrounding, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), emerging policies 7.4 and 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policy 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), emerging policy 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Refuse storage shall be provided in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to thefirst occupation of the development and retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), emerging policies 3.5 and 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (July 2011) policy 5.16. | A minimum of two (2) cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site in accordance with adopted standards of the London Plan 2011. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.  Reason:	To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 9.6 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Core Strategy and policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2011. | Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied arrangements shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority (legal agreement) and be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no residents of the upper floor flats of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit (including visitors' permits) within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time. The professional and legal fees incurred by the Council in drafting and completing the agreement shall be met by the applicant/owner.  Reason: To ensure that the development is car-free and does not exacerbate on-street parking pressure in the local controlled parking zone in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), emerging policy 6.13 of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 6.13 of the London Plan 2011.
